revised_title: On the Perfect Musical Scale and Consonant Chords
tldr: The author investigates the conditions, extent, and realization of a perfect musical scale on instruments with fixed tones. He introduces a new notation system to represent tones and pitches accurately and discusses the necessary conditions for a perfect scale. The author also examines consonant chords and their role in modern music, proposing a classification system for chords based on their relationships and intervals.
